events.message: The customer reported an accident involving their vehicle after colliding with another car at an intersection during rush hour.
The claim was reviewed by the intake team and categorized under auto accident damage for processing by the assigned unit.
An agent was assigned to handle the vehicle collision claim and reach out to the customer to explain the next steps.
The insurance company sent a formal acknowledgment of the claim receipt to the customer via email.
The agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and a copy of the customer's driver license for verification.
The customer uploaded all requested documents, including accident photos, police report, and personal identification.
The claims investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence, checking liability and extent of damages.
After thorough evaluation, the investigation was completed confirming the customerâ€™s vehicle was not at fault.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover repair costs and a rental vehicle during the repair period.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt settlement proposal and the support received throughout the claim process.
The claim was officially approved by the claims manager, authorizing the payment for the vehicle repairs.
Payment was issued to the customer's auto repair shop to cover the approved repair costs.
The claim was closed successfully after the customer confirmed that repairs were completed and all issues resolved.
The finalized claim documents and case files were archived electronically for future reference and auditing purposes.
